conclusion: Plan to analyze the relationship between force and acceleration to determine the coefficient of kinetic friction and mass of A.
Figure 1 shows block A on a smooth surface with block B on top; Figure 2 shows a graph of acceleration vs. force with a linear trend.
The graph shows a linear relationship between acceleration and force, indicating constant mass of block A.
The slope of the line is 1/2 m/s² per N, representing acceleration per unit force.
Equation of motion for block A is F - f = ma, where f is frictional force.
Frictional force f is given by f = μ_k N, where μ_k is the coefficient of kinetic friction.
Normal force N is equal to the weight of block A, mg, since the surface is smooth.
Substitute expressions for f and N into the equation of motion: F - μ_k mg = ma.
From the graph, a = 1/2 F, substitute into F - μ_k mg = ma to get F - μ_k mg = 1/2 F.
Simplify to find μ_k: 1/2 F = μ_k mg.
Since a/F = 1/2, the mass m of block A is 2.
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ_k is 1/2 and the mass m of block A is 2.
